decks.notes: The main concept of this Bazaar Aggro deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with cards such as Basking Rootwalla, Blazing Rootwalla, and Squee, Goblin Nabob in order to bring back powerful creatures like Vengevine and Hollow One. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Force of Will, Force of Negation, and Mindbreak Trap to control the game and protect your key cards. Noxious Revival and Chalice of the Void provide additional ways to disrupt your opponent's game plan while maintaining pressure with aggressive creatures. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient threats and disruption.

The deck aims to quickly assemble a powerful board state by utilizing artifact mana and card draw spells to generate mana and find combo pieces, such as Paradoxical Outcome and Time Vault. The deck also includes disruptive elements like counterspells and Karn, the Great Creator to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By efficiently generating mana and drawing cards, the deck can generate a large advantage and win the game in a quick and explosive manner.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures paired with hate cards to disrupt and slow down opponents. By playing creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Sanctifier en-Vec, along with disruption from cards like Thorn of Amethyst and Chalice of the Void, the deck aims to control the game by limiting the opponent's options and applying pressure with creatures like Luminarch Aspirant and Walking Ballista. The inclusion of Solitude and Archon of Emeria adds flexibility and resilience to deal with a variety of threats while maintaining a proactive game plan.

The key strategy of this deck is to utilize the mechanics of Dredge, including milling cards from the library and returning important creatures from the graveyard to the battlefield. By maximizing the use of cards like Bloodghast, Narcomoeba, and Ichorid, along with cards like Cabal Therapy and Bridge from Below, the deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent with a flood of creatures. Utilizing cards like Bazaar of Baghdad and Wasteland to manipulate the graveyard and disrupt the opponent's resources, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and win the game.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by disrupting the opponent's strategy while drawing cards and searching for key spells. It utilizes powerful control cards like Force of Will, Force of Negation, and counterspells, along with efficient draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Brainstorm. The deck also includes key tutors like Demonic Tutor and Vampiric Tutor to search for win conditions like Bolas's Citadel or Sphinx of the Steel Wind. By managing the opponent's threats and resources while assembling its own win conditions, this Dimir Control deck aims to outmaneuver and outlast its opponent in the long game.

The deck focuses on using efficient spells like Thoughtseize, Force of Will, and Daze to disrupt the opponent's game plan while quickly deploying threats like Death's Shadow and Sedgemoor Witch to close out the game. The deck also utilizes powerful draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time to maintain card advantage. Additionally, the deck includes disruptive creatures like Deathrite Shaman and Street Wraith to further disrupt the opponent's strategy. By combining disruption with aggressive threats, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

This deck is focused on generating a large amount of mana quickly and efficiently through various artifacts such as Moxen and Mana Crypt, as well as utilizing cards like Paradoxical Outcome and Tinker to draw cards and find key combo pieces like Bolas's Citadel. The deck also runs powerful disruptive cards like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect the combo and control the game. Urza, Lord High Artificer and Karn, the Great Creator provide additional utility and win conditions, making this deck a versatile and potent combo deck in Vintage 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on assembling the Bomberman combo of Auriok Salvagers and Black Lotus to generate infinite mana, which can be used to cast powerful spells like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk multiple times in a turn. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils to control the game and protect the combo. The deck utilizes efficient cantrips and card draw spells to find key combo pieces and disrupt opponents' strategies. The mana base is optimized to support the combo while maintaining consistency.

The deck revolves around generating mana through artifacts like Moxen and Tolarian Academy, and drawing cards with Paradoxical Outcome to storm off and win the game in a single turn. It also includes powerful tutors and control elements like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to quickly assemble a winning combination of cards, using efficient draw spells and recursion effects to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of spells and generate a massive advantage.

The focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the Doomsday combo, using cards like Street Wraith and Gitaxian Probe to draw through the deck efficiently. Thassa's Oracle serves as the win condition once Doomsday is resolved, ensuring victory on the same turn. The deck also includes various tutors and counterspells to protect the combo and disrupt opponent's strategies. The mana base is optimized for consistency and allows for quick access to all necessary colors. Overall, the deck is built to quickly and decisively execute its game plan in a competitive environment.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful artifacts and lands to disrupt the opponent's game plan and create a lockout scenario. By playing cards like Sphere of Resistance, Trinisphere, and Thorn of Amethyst, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's spells while deploying threats like Lodestone Golem and Stonecoil Serpent to chip away at their life total. With access to powerful lands like Mishra's Workshop and Wasteland, the deck can generate mana advantage and disrupt the opponent's mana base. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with disruptive artifacts and resilient threats.

This deck focuses on assembling the Dark Depths combo to create a 20/20 indestructible token by using Thespian's Stage to copy Dark Depths. It also utilizes cards like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Karn, the Great Creator to search for combo pieces and disrupt opponent's strategies. Additionally, the deck includes various mana acceleration cards like Mishra's Workshop and Moxen to quickly assemble the combo while using Sphere of Resistance and other disruptive elements to control the game. The Leyline of the Void helps to shut down graveyard strategies commonly seen in Vintage formats.

The key strategy of this deck is to control the game by utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Dack Fayden, Oko, and Wrenn and Six to disrupt the opponent's strategy while generating card advantage. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Flusterstorm, Force of Will, and Pyroblast to protect its own threats and counter the opponent's spells. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Collector Ouphe and Deathrite Shaman allows the deck to further disrupt the opponent's game plan while utilizing efficient mana acceleration. Overall, this deck aims to dominate the game through efficient control and resource management.

This deck focuses on using a combination of efficient creatures and powerful control spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure. It combines the aggressive strategy of an Aggro deck with the versatility and resilience of a Midrange deck, making it well-rounded and adaptable to various matchups. By utilizing disruptive creatures like Collector Ouphe and Leovold, along with powerful spells like Force of Will and Abrupt Decay, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's plans while quickly deploying threats like Tarmogoyf and Oko, Thief of Crowns to close out the game.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively use Bazaar of Baghdad to fill up the graveyard with creatures such as Basking Rootwalla, Blazing Rootwalla, Vengevine, and Hollow One, allowing for explosive starts and consistent aggression. The deck also includes various free counterspells like Force of Will, Force of Vigor, and Force of Negation to protect the board state and disrupt the opponent. Additionally, there are some graveyard recursion elements with cards like Squee, Goblin Nabob and Master of Death. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its fast and efficient creatures and disruption.

The deck focuses on utilizing fast mana artifacts and efficient card draw to power out combo pieces like Paradoxical Outcome and Tinker to assemble game-winning combos quickly. It leverages powerful cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Yawgmoth's Will to generate card advantage and fuel its explosive plays. By efficiently cycling through the deck and generating large amounts of mana, the deck aims to establish a powerful board state and overwhelm opponents before they can respond effectively.
